sections.heading: Proof of unwritten portions of contract admissible where not inconsistent
sections.text:
If the writing does not purport to contain all the stipulations of the contract, parol evidence shall be admissible to prove other portions thereof not inconsistent with the writing; collateral undertakings between parties of the same part among themselves would not properly be looked for in the writing.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

If the writing does not purport to contain all the stipulations of the contract, parol evidence shall be admissible to prove other portions thereof not inconsistent with the writing; collateral undertakings between parties of the same part among themselves would not properly be looked for in the writing.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

If the writing does not purport to contain all the stipulations of the contract, parol evidence shall be admissible to prove other portions thereof not inconsistent with the writing; collateral undertakings between parties of the same part among themselves would not properly be looked for in the writing.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

If the writing does not purport to contain all the stipulations of the contract, parol evidence shall be admissible to prove other portions thereof not inconsistent with the writing; collateral undertakings between parties of the same part among themselves would not properly be looked for in the writing.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Contemporaneous writings explaining each other; parol evidence explaining ambiguities
sections.text:
(a)All contemporaneous writings shall be admissible to explain each other.(b)Parol evidence shall be admissible to explain all ambiguities, both latent and patent.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

(a)All contemporaneous writings shall be admissible to explain each other.(b)Parol evidence shall be admissible to explain all ambiguities, both latent and patent.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

(a)All contemporaneous writings shall be admissible to explain each other.(b)Parol evidence shall be admissible to explain all ambiguities, both latent and patent.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Circumstances surrounding execution of contracts
sections.text:
The surrounding circumstances shall always be proper subjects of proof to aid in the construction of contracts.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

The surrounding circumstances shall always be proper subjects of proof to aid in the construction of contracts.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

The surrounding circumstances shall always be proper subjects of proof to aid in the construction of contracts.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

The surrounding circumstances shall always be proper subjects of proof to aid in the construction of contracts.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Known usage
sections.text:
Evidence of known and established usage shall be admissible to aid in the construction of contracts as well as to annex incidents.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Evidence of known and established usage shall be admissible to aid in the construction of contracts as well as to annex incidents.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Evidence of known and established usage shall be admissible to aid in the construction of contracts as well as to annex incidents.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Evidence of known and established usage shall be admissible to aid in the construction of contracts as well as to annex incidents.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Rebuttal of equity; discharge of contract; proof of subsequent agreement; change of time or place of performance
sections.text:
Parol evidence shall be admissible to rebut an equity, to discharge an entire contract, to prove a new and distinct subsequent agreement, to enlarge the time of performance, or to change the place of performance.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to rebut an equity, to discharge an entire contract, to prove a new and distinct subsequent agreement, to enlarge the time of performance, or to change the place of performance.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to rebut an equity, to discharge an entire contract, to prove a new and distinct subsequent agreement, to enlarge the time of performance, or to change the place of performance.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to rebut an equity, to discharge an entire contract, to prove a new and distinct subsequent agreement, to enlarge the time of performance, or to change the place of performance.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Proof of mistake in deed or written contract
sections.text:
Parol evidence shall be admissible to prove a mistake in a deed or any other contract required by law to be in writing.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to prove a mistake in a deed or any other contract required by law to be in writing.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to prove a mistake in a deed or any other contract required by law to be in writing.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to prove a mistake in a deed or any other contract required by law to be in writing.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Original or subsequent voidness of writing
sections.text:
Parol evidence shall be admissible to show that a writing either was originally void or subsequently became void.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to show that a writing either was originally void or subsequently became void.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to show that a writing either was originally void or subsequently became void.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Parol evidence shall be admissible to show that a writing either was originally void or subsequently became void.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Explanation or denial of receipts
sections.text:
Receipts for money shall always be only prima-facie evidence of payment and may be denied or explained by parol.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Receipts for money shall always be only prima-facie evidence of payment and may be denied or explained by parol.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Receipts for money shall always be only prima-facie evidence of payment and may be denied or explained by parol.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Receipts for money shall always be only prima-facie evidence of payment and may be denied or explained by parol.

Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

sections.heading: Explanation of blank endorsements
sections.text:
Blank endorsements of negotiable paper may always be explained between the parties themselves or those taking with notice of dishonor or of the actual facts of such endorsements.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.

Blank endorsements of negotiable paper may always be explained between the parties themselves or those taking with notice of dishonor or of the actual facts of such endorsements.Added by 2011 Ga. Laws 52,§ 2, eff. 1/1/2013.
